tidybinds.configuration.category_order.t:
Define the order of categories in the §7Key Binds§r screen.

Format: §6category;index§r

Example: §6key.categories.inventory;1§r

Lower numbers appear higher in the list.

To get the name of a category, use the §7Print Categories§r feature.
tidybinds.configuration.Debug.tooltip: Utilities for finding names and debugging configuration issues.
tidybinds.configuration.General.tooltip: Core features for organizing keys, hiding entries, and creating combinations.
tidybinds.configuration.hide_keys.toolti:
Define a list of keys to completely remove from the §7Key Binds§r screen.

Format: §6key§r

Example: §6key.jump§r

To get the name of a key, use the §7Print Keys§r feature.
tidybinds.configuration.key_categories.t:
Move specific keys into a custom or existing categories.

Format: §6key;category§r

Example: §6key.jump;key.categories.inventory§r

If you use a custom category, you should translate it using a resource pack.

To get the name of a category, use the §7Print Categories§r feature.
tidybinds.configuration.key_combinations:
Press multiple linked keys via one trigger key.

Format: §6trigger_key;linked_key,another_linked_key§r

Example: §6key.jump;key.sneak;key.right§r

Linked keys become hidden.

To get the name of a key, use the §7Print Keys§r feature.
tidybinds.configuration.log_actions.tool: Logs §7Tidy Binds§r actions (e.g., §6Moving key X to category Y§r) to the console.
tidybinds.configuration.print_categories: Prints a list of ALL available category names (e.g., §6key.categories.inventory§r) to the log.
tidybinds.configuration.print_keys.toolt: Prints a list of ALL available key names (e.g., §6key.attack§r) to the log.
tidybinds.configuration.show_hidden_keys: Shows hidden keys in a §7Hidden Keys§r category.
tidybinds.configuration.title: §lTidy Binds
